Comment: Oh, Black's trying to be clever by masking his plans for the coming defense by playing Hedgehog-type moves while waiting for White to commit to something besides normal development.

The text is a bit of a departure for me. Typically I'd just play d3-Bg2 and castles, letting subsequent events decide where my Queen is best posted.

The other option, 11. ...d4?!, strikes me as ultimately antipositional and therefore inferior because after 12. Ne2 Black's DSB will remain blocked for a while, nothing but an onlooker as each sides other pieces seek activity. So in my opinion Black made the right move.

?! -- Sometimes the obvious move is the right one. The simple 19. Nce2! is correct in all variations because the discovered attack on c5 forces Black to spend a tempo to defend either with ...b6 or ...Na6 the steed's 3rd trip (!) to that square, allowing White to gain both time and a better postion with moves like 20. b4 or 20. Rac1. This "clever" pawn sac nearly costs White the game.
